medical_history.chief_complaint: Exacerbation of porphyria cutanea tarda (PCT) with high serum levels of iron and ferritin at menopause.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 48-year-old woman, has a 12-year history of PCT with the onset of symptoms including skin fragility, hyperpigmentation, and vesicular eruptions. The symptoms intensified significantly at menopause, requiring increased venesection for treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Porphyria cutanea tarda for 12 years, non-A non-B hepatitis with liver dysfunction diagnosed after a blood transfusion at age 25.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had a history of heavy alcohol consumption during her early career as a bar hostess (averaging 7 to 8 glasses of whiskey daily), later reducing to beer consumption of approximately 250 mL daily.
